alert.note: Alert for Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:53PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Moffat County through 330 PM MDT... At 253 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northeast of Dinosaur, or 41 miles east of Vernal, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Moffat County. This includes U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 30 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
